Acceptance Criteria - Check if average of existing (from TPs) and any overlay will meet the ideal FBS / BE grading.

Comments - In this case, professional services contractor to manage this scope of testing.
Detail of Activity / Test - Indirect Tensile Strength, ITS
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 Optimisation test per aggregate type
○ BSM Dry ITS: 175 kPa to 400 kPa
○ BSM Soaked ITS: 150 kPa to 350 kPa
○ BSM Dry ITS: 210 kPa to 480 kPa
○ BSM Soaked ITS: 180 kPa to 450 kPa
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Designer to advise on binder content(s)
○ Note that the min.design ITS is as per T/19 Notes + 25kPa to ensure that the min.ITS values are obtained in the field
Certification Type - IANZ Accerdiated laboratory test results reports - (Quality Assurance testing)
Comments - In this case, professional services contractor to manage this scope of testing.
Detail of Activity / Test - Unconfined Compressive Strength, UCS
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 Optimisation test per aggregate type
Inspection / Test method - CCNZ / NPTG / CETANZ Industry Guide
Acceptance Criteria - UCS limits set by the design engineeer
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Designer to advise on binder content(s)
○ Note that the min.design ITS is as per T/19 Notes + 25kPa to ensure that the min.ITS values are obtained in the field
Certification Type - IANZ Accerdiated laboratory test results reports - (Quality Assurance testing)
Comments - In this case, professional services contractor to manage this scope of testing.

IDC specifications Frequency - self-propelled pneumatic tyred roller with a minimum weight such that the weight on each tyre is least 2 tonnes, and a tyre pressure of minimum 250 kPa. Proof rolling must comprise at least 10 passes of the roller.

Detail of Activity / Test - Plateau Density Test
Minimum Test Frequency - On first day per site and then 1 per 10,000m2 unless material or anvil conditions change
Inspection / Test method - Draft NZTA T/24 (Aug-2024)
Acceptance Criteria - To establish suitability of rollers and compaction mode / pattern to achieve FBS-MDD

Comments - Allowance to be made under a separate line item for m² rate for site testing.

1. The contract rate shall include allowance for mixing, compacting, trimming and finishing, to the specified tolerances, and the first coat seal.

2. The contract rate shall fully compensate for completely constructing the repair, first coat seal, reinstating the shoulder, removal of surplus chip, and reinstating pavement markings, pavement markers or any other roadside furniture affected by the works, on a like for like basis (excluding any high performance, long life or specialist markings).
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.

Detail of Activity / Test - Geotextile material to be installed.
Minimum Test Frequency - For each pavement tie In locations
Acceptance Criteria - The geotextile must be non-woven
— The geotextile must comply with Strength Class C of TNZ F/7
— The geotextile must comply with Filtration Class 2 of TNZ F/7 with the EOS requirement for cohesive soils
— Jointing of geotextiles must be overlapped. Unless otherwise specified, the minimum overlap must be 500mm.

1. The contract rate must fully compensate for all plant, labour, transport costs and materials required to complete the work including the installation of a First Coat Seal except for the cost of the supply of bitumen which is covered in Item 3211. 2. The contract rate shall fully compensate for completely constructing the repair, first coat seal, reinstating the shoulder, removal of surplus chip, and reinstating pavement markings, pavement markers or any other roadside furniture affected by the works, on a like for like basis (excluding any high performance, long life or specialist markings).
